intro: Bidens cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf beggarticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is an annual herb that thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. It has a hairy stem and produces seeds with pappus structures that aid in wind dispersal. Bidens cordifolia is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
